comments:
1. Create a new JRE (to be deleted later).
2. Create a new Java Application launch config and set the JRE to the new 
JRE. Mark the config as a favorite (to make step 4 easier).
3. Delete the new JRE from the Installed JREs preference page.
4. Pull down the debug button chevron and select the new config to launch 
it.
5. A dialog appears informing the user that the launch failed because the 
specified JRE wasn't found. This is fine. However, we also write the 
following to the log. This scenario is a valid case which we appear to be 
handling well. We shouldn't log the exception.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.launching 4 150 Jun 05, 2002 08:03:09.134
!MESSAGE Specified VM install not found: type 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.launcher.StandardVMType, name blah

This is common code in the debug UI that logs errors when an error dialog is 
shown. The log can sometimes contain extra information for "unexepected" 
errors. Propose not to change at this point.

Perhaps we need to revisit error logging, post 2.0. There is nothing broken 
here, just extra error logging.

Fixed by fix to bug 19581 (but also improved error message).

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 19581 ***

traces.message: Specified VM install not found:  type org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.launcher.StandardVMType, name blah
